baseCategoryThemes.name: Foundations of the Zodiac
baseCategoryThemes.description: A foundational exploration of the zodiacal system, its structure, and core principles.

facets.title: The Four Elements
facets.focus: Fire, Earth, Air, Water - the elemental building blocks of astrological temperament
facets.shortFormHook: The zodiac divides into four elements: Fire signs act, Earth signs build, Air signs think, Water signs feel.

angles.opener: The four elements show up in habits faster than in labels
angles.payload: Watch how you respond under pressure, then name the element.
angles.closer: Which element feels loudest in you this week?

angles.opener: Fire acts, Earth builds, Air thinks, Water feels, and each solves differently
angles.payload: Same problem, different element, totally different approach.
angles.closer: Do you move first, plan first, analyse first, or feel first?

angles.opener: Quick rule: match the element to the problem, not your mood
angles.payload: Some days need Earth even when you feel Fire.
angles.closer: Pick one task and choose an element to complete it.

facets.title: The Three Modalities
facets.focus: Cardinal initiates, Fixed stabilizes, Mutable adapts - the modes of expression
facets.shortFormHook: Cardinal signs begin each season and initiate action. Fixed signs sustain it. Mutable signs transform and release.

angles.opener: The three modalities explain why some people start and others finish
angles.payload: Each mode has a job in the cycle, even when it looks messy.
angles.closer: Are you starting, sustaining, or adapting right now?

angles.opener: Cardinal sparks, Fixed holds, Mutable reshapes, and none are optional
angles.payload: A plan collapses without Fixed, and stagnates without Mutable.
angles.closer: Which mode do you tend to avoid?

angles.opener: Quick rule: initiate, stabilise, then iterate, in that order
angles.payload: Use the right mode at the right moment.
angles.closer: Write one goal and assign it a mode for today.

facets.title: The Twelve Houses
facets.focus: The twelve life areas governed by the houses in a birth chart
facets.shortFormHook: The twelve houses divide the birth chart into life domains, from identity to spirituality, each ruling specific experiences.

angles.opener: The twelve houses answer where life happens, not who you are
angles.payload: They turn vague placements into concrete life arenas.
angles.closer: Which life area feels most activated lately?

angles.opener: A sign is the style, a house is the stage, and timing is the plot
angles.payload: Same planet, different stage, totally different storyline.
angles.closer: Do you read house first or sign first?

angles.opener: A good house check starts with real examples from your week
angles.payload: List what happened, then map it to the house themes.
angles.closer: Pick one house and write three recent examples.

facets.title: Planetary Rulership
facets.focus: Each sign has a ruling planet that colors its expression
facets.shortFormHook: Each zodiac sign is ruled by a planet that shapes its core expression. Mars rules Aries with drive; Venus rules Taurus with sensuality.

angles.opener: Planetary rulership explains the motive underneath the sign’s vibe
angles.payload: Follow the ruler and the chart starts making sense faster.
angles.closer: Do you know the ruler of your Sun sign?

angles.opener: A sign is a lens, the ruler is the engine that drives it
angles.payload: Engine placement shifts how the lens behaves in real life.
angles.closer: Locate a sign ruler and note its house in one sentence.

angles.opener: Quick rule: when a sign feels confusing, check its ruler first
angles.payload: The ruler often shows why the expression feels blocked or loud.
angles.closer: Which sign feels hardest for you to embody?

facets.title: The Ascendant
facets.focus: The rising sign as the mask we wear and how we meet the world
facets.shortFormHook: The Ascendant, or rising sign, is the zodiac sign on the eastern horizon at birth. It shapes first impressions and outward personality.

angles.opener: Your ascendant shows how you enter rooms before you speak
angles.payload: It colours pacing, style, and first impressions.
angles.closer: Do people guess your Sun sign or your rising sign?

angles.opener: Rising sign is not fake, it is adaptive intelligence in motion
angles.payload: It is how you learned to move through the world safely.
angles.closer: Notice your entrance today and describe it in one line.

angles.opener: Quick rule: your chart ruler tells the story behind the ascendant
angles.payload: Find the ruling planet and you find the chart’s steering wheel.
angles.closer: Find your chart ruler and write its sign and house.

facets.title: Aspects and Relationships
facets.focus: How planets in aspect create dialogue - conjunctions, squares, trines
facets.shortFormHook: Aspects are geometric relationships between planets. Trines flow easily; squares create tension that drives growth.

angles.opener: Aspects feel like inner conversations that repeat until you listen
angles.payload: The pattern shows up in choices, not just chart diagrams.
angles.closer: What conversation keeps repeating in your life lately?

angles.opener: Trines flow, squares push, conjunctions merge, and each teaches differently
angles.payload: Ease builds confidence, friction builds skill, merging builds focus.
angles.closer: Do you learn faster through ease or tension?

angles.opener: Quick rule: read aspects as dynamics, not as good or bad
angles.payload: Every aspect becomes useful when you work with it consciously.
angles.closer: Pick one aspect and write how it shows up in behaviour.

facets.title: Reading Your Birth Chart
facets.focus: Synthesizing elements, modalities, houses, and aspects
facets.shortFormHook: A birth chart is a snapshot of the sky at your moment of birth. It maps planetary positions across signs and houses.

angles.opener: A birth chart reads best when you stop hunting one magic placement
angles.payload: The meaning lives in combinations and repeated themes.
angles.closer: Which theme keeps appearing across your chart?

angles.opener: Quick rule: start with big three, then houses, then aspects
angles.payload: Build the skeleton first, then add detail without overwhelm.
angles.closer: Write your big three and one house focus for today.

angles.opener: One chart reading trick is to translate placements into real examples
angles.payload: If you cannot name examples, you are still in theory mode.
angles.closer: Choose one placement and list three lived examples.

angles.opener: Imbolc feels like a pause before new light appears
angles.payload: Hope sits under the frost, waiting to bud.
angles.closer: Where do you feel the first warmth this week?

angles.opener: The season hangs between resting and beginning, and both belong
angles.payload: One moment is stillness, the next is planting trust.
angles.closer: Which side of that threshold needs your attention?

angles.opener: Imbolc is not pressure to leap, it is permission to plan
angles.payload: You can map intention without rushing the spark.
angles.closer: Name one gentle step you can repeat daily.

angles.opener: Quick rule: tend one steady ember instead of chasing a blaze
angles.payload: A single ritual keeps the flame ready when the sun returns.
angles.closer: Choose one small light and keep it lit each evening.

angles.opener: A reliable signal is curiosity for slow change
angles.payload: When things stay calm, your nervous system knows repair is happening.
angles.closer: What shift feels safe to observe before it shows up?

baseCategoryThemes.name: Understanding Planetary Rulership
baseCategoryThemes.description: Deep exploration of each classical planet and its astrological significance.

facets.title: The Sun
facets.focus: Core identity, vitality, and conscious self-expression
facets.shortFormHook: The Sun represents core identity and life force. Its sign shows how you express your essential self and where you seek recognition.

angles.opener: The Sun shows what you protect when everything else gets noisy
angles.payload: It is the part of you that wants to be seen clearly.
angles.closer: What part of you feels most real lately?

angles.opener: Sun confidence feels different from Sun performance, and both matter
angles.payload: One is inner permission, the other is outward expression.
angles.closer: Do you feel more pressure to shine or to be understood?

angles.opener: A Sun check is simple: ask what makes you feel proud without proving
angles.payload: That answer usually points straight at your core.
angles.closer: Write one sentence: I feel most like myself when I ___.

facets.title: The Moon
facets.focus: Emotional nature, instincts, and the unconscious
facets.shortFormHook: The Moon governs emotional instincts and inner needs. Its sign reveals how you process feelings and what makes you feel secure.

angles.opener: The Moon shows what you need when you are tired, not inspired
angles.payload: Your comfort patterns are the clue, even the messy ones.
angles.closer: What actually soothes you, not just distracts you?

angles.opener: Moon work is not being emotional, it is being honest with needs
angles.payload: Needs do not disappear when you ignore them.
angles.closer: Name one need today and meet it in a small way.

angles.opener: Quick rule: your Moon is your baseline, not your highlight reel
angles.payload: It is the daily rhythm that keeps you steady.
angles.closer: What does your baseline look like right now?

facets.title: Mercury
facets.focus: Communication, thought patterns, and mental processing
facets.shortFormHook: Mercury rules the mind and communication. Its placement shows how you think, learn, and express ideas.

angles.opener: Mercury shows how you translate life into words, patterns, and plans
angles.payload: Your learning style is hiding in plain sight.
angles.closer: Do you learn by doing, debating, reading, or observing?

angles.opener: Mercury speed is not the same as Mercury clarity, and both can shift
angles.payload: Fast does not always mean accurate, slow does not mean stuck.
angles.closer: Do you need more space or more structure right now?

angles.opener: A Mercury reset starts with one clean sentence and nothing extra
angles.payload: Clarity is often subtraction, not addition.
angles.closer: Rewrite one thought today as a single sentence.

facets.title: Venus
facets.focus: Love, beauty, values, and attraction
facets.shortFormHook: Venus governs love, beauty, and values. Its sign reveals what you find attractive and how you express affection.

angles.opener: Venus shows what you naturally return to when life feels harsh
angles.payload: Taste is a compass, not a luxury.
angles.closer: What kind of beauty calms your nervous system?

angles.opener: Attraction and values are linked, but they are not identical
angles.payload: One pulls you in, the other decides what stays.
angles.closer: What do you want, and what do you stand for?

angles.opener: A Venus practice is choosing one small pleasure without justification
angles.payload: Pleasure can be clean, simple, and grounded.
angles.closer: Pick one nourishing pleasure today and let it count.

facets.title: Mars
facets.focus: Drive, assertion, passion, and how we take action
facets.shortFormHook: Mars represents drive, assertion, and desire. Its placement shows how you pursue goals and express anger.

angles.opener: Mars shows how you move when you are sure, and when you are threatened
angles.payload: It is energy, boundaries, and instincts in motion.
angles.closer: Do you chase, defend, or withdraw under pressure?

angles.opener: Mars is not aggression, it is the courage to act cleanly
angles.payload: Healthy Mars is direct, not explosive.
angles.closer: Say one honest boundary today, short and kind.

angles.opener: Quick rule: when Mars is blocked, start with the smallest action
angles.payload: Momentum builds confidence faster than perfect planning.
angles.closer: Do the first two minutes of the task, then reassess.

facets.title: Jupiter
facets.focus: Expansion, luck, philosophy, and growth
facets.shortFormHook: Jupiter expands whatever it touches, bringing growth and opportunity. Its sign shows where you find meaning and abundance.

angles.opener: Jupiter shows what grows when you stop playing small in your mind
angles.payload: Belief can be an engine, not just an idea.
angles.closer: Where do you feel ready to expand this year?

angles.opener: Jupiter optimism works best with a plan, not with blind faith
angles.payload: Expansion is real when it has structure to land in.
angles.closer: Name one risk and one support for it, in two lines.

angles.opener: Quick rule: follow curiosity, then verify with reality
angles.payload: Curiosity opens doors, verification keeps you safe.
angles.closer: Try one curious step today, then review what happened.

facets.title: Saturn
facets.focus: Structure, discipline, limitations, and mastery
facets.shortFormHook: Saturn represents structure, discipline, and life lessons. Its placement reveals where you face challenges that build mastery.

angles.opener: Saturn shows the place you become strong through repetition, not hype
angles.payload: It is the long road, but it is yours.
angles.closer: What are you quietly mastering right now?

angles.opener: Saturn pressure can feel heavy, but it also builds real authority
angles.payload: The same weight becomes a backbone over time.
angles.closer: What responsibility is shaping you lately?

angles.opener: Saturn work is choosing one constraint and letting it help you focus
angles.payload: Constraints can be a container, not a punishment.
angles.closer: Pick one rule for today and keep it all day.

angles.opener: Saturn work is choosing one constraint and letting it help you focus
angles.payload: Constraints can be a container, not a punishment.
angles.closer: Pick one rule for today and keep it all day.

facetPool.title: Uranus
facetPool.shortFormHook: Uranus rules breakthroughs and rebellion. Its sign shows where you crave freedom, originality, and sudden change.

angles.opener: Uranus brings the moment you cannot pretend the old way still fits
angles.payload: The discomfort is often a signal of overdue growth.
angles.closer: Where do you feel ready to change the rules?

angles.opener: Uranus freedom is not chaos, it is truth with movement
angles.payload: Liberation can be clean, precise, and intentional.
angles.closer: Replace one habit today with a truer alternative.

angles.opener: Quick rule: when Uranus hits, keep what works and update the rest
angles.payload: You do not need to burn everything down to evolve.
angles.closer: Pick one system and upgrade one small piece of it.

facetPool.title: Neptune
facetPool.shortFormHook: Neptune dissolves boundaries and heightens intuition. Its sign reveals where you seek meaning, mystery, and spiritual connection.

angles.opener: Neptune blurs the edges so you can feel what logic misses
angles.payload: Intuition grows when you listen without forcing certainty.
angles.closer: What feeling keeps returning even when you doubt it?

angles.opener: Neptune is not delusion, it is sensitivity that needs boundaries
angles.payload: Clarity arrives when you ground the message in reality.
angles.closer: Write the intuition, then write one verifiable next step.

angles.opener: Quick rule: if it is foggy, slow down and reduce inputs
angles.payload: Noise can masquerade as intuition.
angles.closer: Take ten minutes of quiet and see what remains.

facetPool.title: Pluto
facetPool.focus: Transformation, power, shadow work, and renewal
facetPool.shortFormHook: Pluto governs deep transformation. Its sign shows where you shed the old, reclaim power, and regenerate.

angles.opener: Pluto work starts when you stop negotiating with what hurts you
angles.payload: Transformation is often a boundary, not a glow up.
angles.closer: What are you no longer willing to carry?

angles.opener: Pluto intensity can feel like crisis, but it is also cleansing
angles.payload: It reveals what is real by removing what is not.
angles.closer: Where are you being asked to tell the truth?

angles.opener: One Pluto practice is naming the fear, then choosing the next brave step
angles.payload: Power returns when you act with clarity.
angles.closer: Write the fear in one line, then write the next action.

angles.opener: Ostara feels like the scales ticking toward warmth
angles.payload: Equal day and night hint at momentum about to swing.
angles.closer: What part of your week wants a little more light?

angles.opener: Balance is not neutral, it is a turning point waiting to sway
angles.payload: You're leaving stillness and moving toward growth.
angles.closer: Are you leaning toward action or tending the soil?

angles.opener: Ostara is not a single grand leap, it is the quiet shift between cycles
angles.payload: Matching small routines to the daylight keeps you honest.
angles.closer: List one slow change you’ll steward for the next three mornings.

angles.opener: Quick rule: pair one seed idea with one restful boundary
angles.payload: Rest protects the new momentum.
angles.closer: Sketch one rest block and one courage block and keep both small.

angles.opener: A signal Ostara landed is feeling energy settle into curiosity
angles.payload: When the body welcomes change, you know the momentum is ready.
angles.closer: What curiosity is asking for more space right now?

baseCategoryThemes.name: Tarot as a Symbolic System
baseCategoryThemes.description: Understanding tarot as a complete symbolic language for self-reflection.

facets.title: Structure of the Deck
facets.focus: 78 cards: 22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor Arcana
facets.shortFormHook: The tarot deck contains 78 cards: 22 Major Arcana representing life lessons, and 56 Minor Arcana reflecting daily experiences.

angles.opener: Tarot clicks when you stop treating each card as isolated
angles.payload: The deck is a system, so meanings echo across cards.
angles.closer: Do you read cards as stories or as single symbols?

angles.opener: Major Arcana feels like chapters, Minor Arcana feels like scenes
angles.payload: Both matter, but they move at different speeds.
angles.closer: Which shows up more in your pulls lately?

angles.opener: A deck structure trick is to sort by arcana and notice patterns
angles.payload: Patterns teach faster than memorising keywords.
angles.closer: Pull one Major and one Minor and compare their timing.

facets.title: The Fool's Journey
facets.focus: The Major Arcana as a narrative of spiritual development
facets.shortFormHook: The Major Arcana tells the Fool's Journey, a narrative arc from innocence through trials to integration and wholeness.

angles.opener: The Fool’s Journey is a map for growth that repeats in cycles
angles.payload: You can be The Fool and The World in the same month.
angles.closer: Which chapter are you living right now?

angles.opener: The Fool is not naive, it is brave enough to begin
angles.payload: Beginnings look messy because they are alive.
angles.closer: Name one beginning you have been delaying and take one step.

angles.opener: Quick rule: read Major Arcana as themes, not predictions
angles.payload: Theme reading keeps you grounded and accurate.
angles.closer: What theme keeps following you lately?

facets.title: The Four Suits
facets.focus: Wands (Fire), Cups (Water), Swords (Air), Pentacles (Earth)
facets.shortFormHook: The four suits correspond to elements: Wands to Fire and passion, Cups to Water and emotion, Swords to Air and mind, Pentacles to Earth and matter.

angles.opener: Suit patterns reveal what domain of life is actually asking for attention
angles.payload: Repeats matter more than one dramatic card.
angles.closer: Which suit keeps showing up for you?

angles.opener: Wands ignite, Cups soften, Swords sharpen, Pentacles stabilise
angles.payload: Each suit pulls a different lever in your life.
angles.closer: Do you need ignition, softness, clarity, or stability today?

angles.opener: A suit practice is to describe your day using one suit only
angles.payload: It trains your intuition to spot the dominant energy fast.
angles.closer: Pick one suit and label three moments from today.

facets.title: Number Symbolism
facets.focus: Aces through Tens - the numerological progression
facets.shortFormHook: In tarot, numbers carry meaning: Aces are beginnings, Fives bring conflict, Tens represent completion of a cycle.

angles.opener: Numbers tell you the phase of the story even before the imagery
angles.payload: The number often nails timing better than the suit.
angles.closer: Are you in a beginning, challenge, or completion phase?

angles.opener: Aces open doors, Fives test you, Tens close cycles, and it is precise
angles.payload: Progression turns readings from vague into usable.
angles.closer: Pull two cards and read only the numbers first.

angles.opener: Quick rule: read the number as the stage, then add suit as the domain
angles.payload: Stage plus domain equals clarity.
angles.closer: Write one line: stage, domain, message.

facets.title: Court Cards
facets.focus: Page, Knight, Queen, King - aspects of personality or people
facets.shortFormHook: Court cards represent personality aspects or people. Pages are students, Knights are seekers, Queens embody mastery, Kings command authority.

angles.opener: Court cards show roles you step into, not just people you meet
angles.payload: They describe behaviour patterns that rotate across time.
angles.closer: Which role are you playing right now, Page, Knight, Queen, or King?

angles.opener: Court cards are not always romance, they are often identity shifts
angles.payload: They can mark maturity, confidence, or new learning.
angles.closer: Where are you levelling up without noticing?

angles.opener: A court card trick is to ask what skill is developing, not who it is
angles.payload: Skill focus makes the reading instantly practical.
angles.closer: Name one skill you are learning and map it to Page, Knight, Queen, or King.

facets.title: Reading Patterns
facets.focus: Spreads, positions, and card relationships
facets.shortFormHook: Tarot spreads assign meaning through position. Cards in relationship reveal nuance beyond individual card meanings.

angles.opener: Tarot becomes accurate when you read relationships between cards
angles.payload: One card is a word, a spread is a sentence.
angles.closer: Do you read the middle card first or the edges?

angles.opener: Positions give structure, but the gaps between cards hold the nuance
angles.payload: Contrast and repetition reveal the message.
angles.closer: Circle repeating symbols across a spread and read those first.

angles.opener: Quick rule: ask one clear question per spread and keep it narrow
angles.payload: Clarity in question gives clarity in answer.
angles.closer: Rewrite your question into one sentence before pulling.

facets.title: Tarot as Mirror
facets.focus: Using tarot for self-reflection rather than prediction
facets.shortFormHook: Tarot functions as a mirror for the unconscious, surfacing what is already known but not yet articulated.

angles.opener: Tarot works best when you treat it like a mirror, not a verdict
angles.payload: It shows what you already know but have not named.
angles.closer: What truth are you circling around lately?

angles.opener: A reflective reading is not vague, it is precise about inner patterns
angles.payload: Patterns create outcomes more than luck does.
angles.closer: Ask: what is the pattern, and what is the next choice?

angles.opener: A simple mirror spread is: now, next, and what I am avoiding
angles.payload: It cuts through noise quickly.
angles.closer: Pull three cards and write one line per position.

angles.opener: Beltane feels like the bones of desire loosening into dance
angles.payload: The season pushes for celebration and authentic expression.
angles.closer: Where does your body want to move more fully?

angles.opener: This fire season is bold compared to Imbolc's hush
angles.payload: Growth is louder now but still grounded in reverence.
angles.closer: What feels worthy of both tenderness and heat?

angles.opener: Beltane is not only romance, it is creative magnetism meeting responsibility
angles.payload: Even playful rituals have structure when you make them intentional.
angles.closer: Name one joyful act you can repeat with intention today.

angles.opener: Quick rule: pair one bold feeling with one grounded check-in
angles.payload: That preserves clarity when the energy rises.
angles.closer: Check in with your breath before you act on a craving.

angles.opener: A signal the season is real is sudden generosity without exhaustion
angles.payload: When you feel expansive yet steady, the festival has arrived.
angles.closer: Where are you ready to offer energy without burning out?

baseCategoryThemes.name: Emotional Cycles and the Moon
baseCategoryThemes.description: Understanding lunar phases and their influence on emotional rhythms.

facets.title: The Eight Phases
facets.focus: New, Waxing Crescent, First Quarter, Waxing Gibbous, Full, Waning Gibbous, Last Quarter, Waning Crescent
facets.shortFormHook: The Moon moves through eight phases in 29.5 days, each carrying distinct energy from initiation to release.

angles.opener: The eight phases track emotional timing better than brute force planning
angles.payload: Energy rises, peaks, then asks for release and integration.
angles.closer: Which phase matches your energy this week?

angles.opener: Waxing builds momentum, waning clears space, and both are productive
angles.payload: Clearing is action, not failure.
angles.closer: Choose one thing to build and one thing to release today.

angles.opener: Quick rule: begin at New, refine at quarters, release at Full
angles.payload: Use the phase as a rhythm, not a rulebook.
angles.closer: Write one intention and one release in two lines.

facets.title: New Moon
facets.focus: Beginnings, intention setting, planting seeds
facets.shortFormHook: The New Moon marks the beginning of the lunar cycle. It is a time for setting intentions and initiating new projects.

angles.opener: New Moon energy is quiet, and it rewards small committed beginnings
angles.payload: The seed matters more than the spectacle.
angles.closer: What do you want to begin in a gentle way?

angles.opener: Intentions are not wishes, they are choices you keep choosing
